solution_line_template: If Phil had won {phil_more_than_charlie} games more than did Charlie, and Phil won {phil_games} games, then Charlie won {phil_games}-{phil_more_than_charlie}=<<{phil_games}-{phil_more_than_charlie}={charlie_games}>>{charlie_games} games.

If Charlie had won {charlie_fewer_than_dana} games fewer than Dana, and Charlie won {charlie_games} games, then Dana won {charlie_games}+{charlie_fewer_than_dana}=<<{charlie_games}+{charlie_fewer_than_dana}={dana_games}>>{dana_games} games.

If Perry had won {perry_more_than_dana} more games than did Dana, and Dana won {dana_games} games, then Perry won {dana_games}+{perry_more_than_dana}=<<{dana_games}+{perry_more_than_dana}={perry_games}>>{perry_games} games.
Thus, Perry won {perry_games}-{phil_games}=<<{perry_games}-{phil_games}={perry_more_than_phil}>>{perry_more_than_phil} more games than did Phil.
